alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 22 at 1:55PM MST until December 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY THROUGH EARLY THIS WEEKEND... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Central Carbon County to include Rawlins and Sinclair. North Snowy Range Foothills to include Arlington and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Near zero visibility in snow and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; North Snowy Range Foothills
